text: Produce no waste for one whole day
fact: 2016 alone Europe produced over 27 million tons of plastic waste.
An average tree absorbs as much as 21.77kg of CO2 per year.

text: Change all remaining lightbulbs in your home out for LEDs
fact: LEDs need 80% less ernergy compared to classic lightbulbs.

text: Buy locally sourced produce on your nearest farmers market
fact: Buying a tomato produced overseas costs over twice as much CO2 as it would buying a locally produced one.

text: Carshare! Take someone with you in your car
fact: Cars are responsible for around 12% of total EU emissions of carbon dioxide (CO2), the main greenhouse gas.

text: Reuse something you would have normally thrown away
fact: PET, the most commonly used plastic in water bottles, can be safely reused. No need to throw them away immediately.

text: Check out a second hand store instead of buying something new
fact: It has been estimated that in 2015 EU citizens bought 6.4 million tonnes of new clothing (12.66 kg per person).
A water saving showerhead cuts water consumtion while showering in half.
Growing and shipping a tomatoe bought in march produces almost 30 times as much CO2 as it would in september.
